alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following counties, Decatur and Norton. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1143 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding along Highway 383 across western portions of Norton county. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Norton, Almena, Lenora, Norcatur, Clayton, Edmond, Reager, New Almelo and Calvert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
